intro: Bromus polystachios, commonly known as the purple needlegrass, is a perennial grass native to western North America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and distinctive purple-tinged inflorescence, which consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and along coastal dunes. Its deep root system helps prevent soil erosion and makes it an important component of native plant communities. It is also a valuable forage plant for livestock and wildlife.
